description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Cyclone Chido, Pelicot Verdict, and Santa Visits Hospital

description: Justice Minister Arif Virani would not say whether he wants Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to remain as leader amid internal tensions among the Liberals following Chrystia Freeland’s resignation from cabinet. Virani was asked repeatedly by reporters on Dec. 19 whether he wants Trudeau to stay on. “I think it’s really important that decisions will be […]
title: Justice Minister Virani Mum on Trudeau Support

description: The Alberta government says it has heard back from Canada’s chief actuary on its bid to leave the Canada Pension Plan, but there’s no estimate on how much the province should get. The province has been waiting for months for the review and a figure. “We received their interpretation of the legislation, but it did […]
title: Alberta Says Chief Actuary’s Pension Plan Report Offers No Estimate of Province’s Share for Leaving

description: The number of new family doctors providing care in Canada has slowed over the past decade, according to a new report. The annual report from the Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI), examines trends among health-care professionals offering primary care services. The growth of doctors entering the field has slowed from 3 percent between 2015 […]
title: Number of Family Doctors in Canada on Decline Over Last 10 Years

description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with journalist, author, and sociologist Ashley Frawley for the second half of this interview. Frawley talks about falling birth rates, how modern life and institutions attack the family, and the dangers of a society that doesn’t live for the next generation.
title: The Idea We Can’t Afford to Have Children Is a Shocking Indictment of Our Society: Ashley Frawley

description: “Merry Christmas” remains the greeting of choice in Canada during the holiday season, according to a new poll. The preferred festive greeting for 62 percent of Canadians is “Merry Christmas,” while only 24 percent prefer “Happy Holidays.” Fourteen percent of respondents to the newly released survey from the B.C.-based Research Co. didn’t have a preference. […]
title: Canadians Prefer ‘Merry Christmas’ Over ‘Happy Holidays’: Survey

description: Alberta’s police watchdog says there’s no evidence an offence was committed when Mounties used force to arrest a First Nation chief outside a Fort McMurray, Alta., casino in 2020. The Alberta Serious Incident Response Team also says there’s no evidence of racist treatment by officers against Athabasca Chipewyan First Nation Chief Allan Adam. It says […]
title: No Charges Against Mounties in Arrest of Prominent Alberta Chief

description: Commentary According to recent polling, pride in country is in a state of precipitous decline. Understanding the reasons for this trend provides considerable insight into how the Canadian public’s values have shifted through the past several decades. Polling data published by the Angus Reid Institute on Dec. 13 compares how Canadians have answered the question […]
title: Why Does Polling Show Canadian National Pride in Freefall?

description: The president of the Vancouver Police Union has criticized the handling of a sexual assault case that ended in the suicide of a Central Saanich Police officer. Ralph Kaisers says in a letter to members that was obtained by The Canadian Press that the “tragic loss” of the officer came after public statements that risked […]
title: Vancouver Police Union Criticizes Assault Case’s Handling After Officer’s Suicide

description: German Chancellor said he will press President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen on the state of the auto industry.
title: EU Automakers to Raise Gas-Powered Car Prices Due to Net Zero Fines

description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken participates in a UN Security Council Session on Sudan in New York City. The event is scheduled to begin at 1:30 p.m. ET on Dec. 19.
title: Blinken Participates in UN Security Council Session on Sudan

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will shuffle his cabinet on Friday morning. A government source confirms a swearing-in ceremony will take place at Rideau Hall. This comes at the end of a tumultuous week that saw Trudeau lose his finance minister and face a new swell of pressure within his caucus for him to resign. Before […]
title: Trudeau to Shuffle Cabinet Friday as Pressure for Him to Resign Remains

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his Liberal government have hit an all-time low in public opinion since coming to power in 2015, with more than two-thirds of Canadians saying it’s time for Trudeau to step down, a new poll says. In the Dec. 17 Abacus Data poll, 67 percent of Canadians said Trudeau should resign, […]
title: 67 Percent of Canadians Say It’s Time for Trudeau to Resign: Survey

description: The review will also look into how Ofgem can help the government in its 'clean power' mission and support the private sector to invest in energy infrastructure.
title: Reform to Energy Regular Will Give Consumers More Protections, Says Government

description: Quebec anticorruption police have arrested a former university professor for allegedly defrauding and extorting foreign students. Police say René Wamkeue used schemes to steal scholarship money that was intended for the foreign master’s and doctoral students he supervised. In a news release, the anticorruption unit known as UPAC says Wamkeue is facing charges of fraud, […]
title: Quebec Professor Charged for Stealing Scholarship Money Intended for Foreign Students

description: The first person to ever serve as the member of Parliament for Nunavut is being appointed to the Senate. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will announce the appointment of Nancy Karetak-Lindell to fill Nunavut’s only Senate seat today. She was elected to Parliament in 1997 after playing a key role in negotiations to establish Nunavut as […]
title: Nancy Karetak-Lindell, Former MP, Appointed as Nunavut Senator

description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has also told the Financial Times her country would have to tear up a defense funding plan drawn up earlier this year.
title: Denmark Warns ‘Aggressive’ Russian Behavior Could Trigger Arctic Confrontation

description: London announced it had agreed to hand over the Indian Ocean Archipelago in October, but the new government in Port Louis wishes to alter the terms.
title: Mauritius Wants to Renegotiate Chagos Islands Deal With UK

description: Mason Rist, 15, and Max Dixon, 16, died in an attack that lasted less than a minute and saw four teenagers use a baseball bat and machetes.
title: 4 Teenagers Sentenced for Double Murder in Case of Mistaken Identity

description: The new support package includes £186 million to fund key military equipment and £39 million for more than 1,000 counter-drone electronic warfare systems.
title: UK Pledges £225 Million Military Aid Package to Ukraine

description: More than 6,000 toddler stools have been recalled in Canada after reports that a child’s head became caught between the bars of the stool. Health Canada has identified the Qaba Toddler Kitchen Helper 2 Step Stool from Aosom Canada Inc. as a safety issue, and is urging parents to immediately stop using the product. “The […]
title: Toddler Step Stools Recalled After Child’s Head Becomes Trapped

description: From January to December, all year round, some Canadians seek to keep the Christmas spirit alive. “I love Christmas through and through. It’s magical,” Denise D’Angicco of Blue Mountains, Ont., told The Epoch Times. “I think it’s a happy-go-lucky feeling that people—a lot of us—are missing these days for so many different reasons. … I […]
title: Canada’s Year-Round Christmas Enthusiasts—It’s Their Time to Shine

description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford is advocating for a united front between Canada and the United States to confront trade issues arising from China, rather than resorting to a damaging trade war against each other. Ford told CNN this week that it’s time to focus on China’s ploy of using Mexico to ship goods into North […]
title: Ontario Premier Urges Canada and US to Avoid Trade War and Confront China

description: Former central banker Mark Carney will not be joining the Liberal government and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is giving no indication he will step down, according to newly-minted Finance Minister Dominic LeBlanc. LeBlanc spoke on several hot issues having gripped Ottawa in recent days in an interview with Brunswick News. The minister from New Brunswick […]
title: Carney Won’t Join Government, Trudeau Gives No Sign of Leaving: Minister LeBlanc

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin also challenged the West to a 'high-tech duel' to see if they could protect a target in Kyiv from Russia's Oreshnik missile.
title: Putin Ready for ‘Compromises’ Over Ukraine in Talks With Trump

description: The degree to which Canadians can make personal and economic choices has increased since hitting a two-decade low in 2020 amid COVID-19 restrictions, but remains below pre-pandemic levels, a new study suggests. The findings are part of a global trend observed since the pandemic, with nearly 90 percent of people in 165 countries losing freedom […]
title: Freedom in Canada on the Rise, but Below Pre-Pandemic Level: Report

description: The decision to hold interest rates comes amid growing inflationary pressures and contraction of the UK economy.
title: Bank of England Keeps Interest Rates Unchanged at 4.75 Percent

description: The Lion Electric Co. says it has been granted protection from creditors under the Companies’ Creditors Arrangement Act by the Superior Court of Quebec. The electric bus maker says it plans to seek recognition of the CCAA proceedings in the U.S. under Chapter 15 of the Bankruptcy Code. Deloitte Restructuring Inc. has been appointed as […]
title: Electric Bus Maker Lion Electric Granted Creditor Protection by Quebec Court

description: Canada Post is set to start accepting commercial letters and parcels as it works to get back to normal operations following a month-long strike. The postal service has warned Canadians should expect delays into the new year as it works through a backlog of mail, after workers went back on the job Tuesday. Canada Post […]
title: Canada Post to Start Taking Commercial Mail Again

description: The former head of state faces one year of electronic monitoring after being found guilty of corruption and influence peddling.
title: France’s Highest Court Upholds Corruption Conviction of Former President Nicolas Sarkozy

description: MUMBAI—Helicopters and divers scoured the waters off India’s financial capital of Mumbai on Thursday in a search for survivors of a freak boat accident that killed at least 13 people a day earlier, three navy personnel among them, officials said. A naval speedboat lost control and collided with a privately owned vessel taking tourists to […]
title: Divers, Helicopters Hunt Survivors of Mumbai Boat Accident That Killed 13

description: Thames Water faces nearly £16 billion debt and needs £3.3 billion over the next five years to keep running.
title: Thames Water Penalised £18.2 Million Over Dividends as Ofwat Clears 35 Percent Bill Rise

description: In one incident, the teens attacked a woman, slapping her, throwing her to the ground, and then kicking her, causing her to briefly lose consciousness.
title: 2 Teenage Girls Sentenced After Anti-Semitic ‘Rampage’

description: New ministerial direction limits international student numbers with revised forecast pushing net migration to 340,000.
title: Minister Issues New Directive to Cut International Student Numbers into Australia

description: Veteran cartoonist Michael Leunig was a staple of Australian media for over 50 years.
title: ‘The Pen Has Run Dry’: Australian Political Cartoonist Michael Leunig Dies, Aged 79

description: The trial attracted global headlines after Gisèle Pelicot waived her right to anonymity and a behind-closed-doors trial.
title: Dominique Pelicot Jailed for 20 Years in Historic French Rape Trial

description: WASHINGTON—The head of a U.S.-based Syrian advocacy organization on Monday said that a mass grave outside of Damascus contained the bodies of at least 100,000 people killed by the former government of ousted President Bashar al-Assad. Mouaz Moustafa, speaking to Reuters in a telephone interview from Damascus, said the site at al Qutayfah, 25 miles […]
title: At Least 100,000 Bodies in Syrian Mass Grave, US Advocacy Group Head Says

description: The CEIG said its members supported renewables, which they consider the least-cost technologies.
title: ‘Not Commercially Viable’: Energy Investors Reject Nuclear Investment in Australia

description: The Albanese government is cutting funding to an Australian think tank.
title: Funding Cuts to Think Tank Critical of Beijing a Sign of Appeasement: Senator

description: Leaders of the Chinese police station have helped Beijing organize counter protests against Falun Gong demonstrations, locate the regime's targets.
title: Chinese Agent Pleads Guilty to Operating Secret Police Station in New York

description: The value of work done on renewable projects by NSW in 2023-24 was more than twice that of Queensland and triple that of Victoria.
title: NSW Tops Australia in Completing Renewable Projects

description: As the Assad regime fell, the IDF seized Syrian positions on the Israeli border, plus the demilitarized buffer zone, to keep them out of rebel hands.
title: Netanyahu, Visiting Mount Hermon, Indicates the IDF Will Stay Awhile

description: Australia's relief efforts in Vanuatu have begun after the tiny island nation was struck by two earthquakes and a number of aftershocks this week.
title: 148 Australians Return Home From Quake-Stricken Vanuatu

description: The initiative offers up to 5 percent lower interest rates, helping workers save thousands on new and used electric cars.
title: Albanese Government Launches Low-Interest EV Loans for Those Earning Less Than $100,000 a Year

description: The Canadian dollar dropped below 70 cents U.S. for the first time in about four and a half years and only the fourth time in the past 30 years, after a tumultuous week in politics. The loonie reached a low of US$0.69 on Dec. 17, according to Bank of Canada data. The drop came just […]
title: Canadian Dollar Falls Below 70 US Cents for First Time in Nearly 5 Years

description: A Montreal-area Jewish synagogue and community centre were targeted in a firebombing attack for the second time in just over a year, prompting outrage from the Jewish community. The Dec. 18 overnight attack targeted the Beth Tikvah synagogue and the West Island Federation CJA building in Dollard-des-Ormeaux on Montreal’s West Island. Incendiary devices thrown at […]
title: Montreal Jewish Centre Firebombed for 2nd Time in Just Over a Year

description: $10 million will be provided for heat and electricity for the people of Ukraine.
title: Australia Reopens Ukraine Embassy and Provides $1.5 Billion Total Funding

description: If joined, the two Japanese companies would be the third largest automaker in the world.
title: Honda and Nissan Neither Confirm Nor Deny Report of Possible Merger

description: Economists caution against perpetual debt and stagnation for future generations without bold fiscal and economic reforms.
title: Debt Storm Brewing: Economists Warn Australia’s Budget on Shaky Ground

description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says Canada’s role in supplying raw materials essential to the U.S. economy explains the trade deficit the country has with its northern neighbour as President-elect Donald Trump asked why his country is continuing to “subsidize” Canada. Smith made the remarks in a Dec. 18 social media post in response to Trump’s […]
title: Premier Smith Responds to Trump’s Trade Deficit Question, Highlights Canada’s Role in US Economy

description: A higher education think tank has called for more transparent data on transnational education student success rates, degree outcomes, and job prospects.
title: Number of Students Pursuing UK University Degrees Abroad Nears 600,000: Report
